abstract: Bus driver of Transport Workers Union Local 100 demonstrate in Upper Manhattan as part of ongoing dispute over law that heavily penalizes them for injuring or killing pedestrians or cyclists who have right of way; demonstration snarls traffic, and is intended to show that delays are inevitable if they strictly adhere to letter of new law.
lead_paragraph: Transport Workers Union Local 100 is seeking to exclude bus drivers from a new law that made failure to yield a misdemeanor if a driver injures or kills a pedestrian or cyclist.

headline.main: Union Pushing to Amend Traffic Law for Bus Drivers
headline.print_headline: Bus Drivers’ Union Pushes to Amend a Traffic Law

snippet: Transport Workers Union Local 100 is seeking to exclude bus drivers from a new law that made failure to yield a misdemeanor if a driver injures or kills a pedestrian or cyclist.
